Package gui

Class DPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.DPoint
  • public class DPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance is a point (x, y)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double TOLERANCE
      Tolerance to consider two point components equal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DPoint()
      Constructor: a point (0, 0).
      DPoint​(double x, double y)
      Constructor: a point (x, y).
      DPoint​(DPoint v)
      Constructor: a point with same values as v.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DPoint addVector​(DPoint v)
      Add v's components to this point and return this DPoint
      double cos​(DPoint b)
      Return the cosine of the angle between this and b.
      static double cos​(DPoint a, DPoint b)
      Return the cosine of the angle between a and b
      double cross​(DPoint b)
      Return the cross product of this and b.
      static double cross​(DPoint a, DPoint b)
      Return the cross product of a and b.
      Because vectors are 2-d, the return is a vector of the form <0, 0, z>
      So a 1-D vector.
      double distance​(DPoint b)
      Return the distance between this point and b.
      static double distance​(DPoint a, DPoint b)
      Return the distance between a and b.
      double dot​(DPoint b)
      Return the dot product of this DPoint and b.
      static double dot​(DPoint a, DPoint b)
      Return the dot product of a and b/
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object ob)
      Return true iff ob is a DPoint and is equal to this one.
      Two points are equal if their components are equal
      - thus checks if they have the same hashcodes,
      which are built off of their components
      double getX()
      Return this point's x component.
      double getY()
      Return this point's y component.
      int hashCode()
      Hash this point based on its components, using function Objects.hash.
      Round both components to the nearest TOLERANCE
      DPoint invert()
      Invert both of this' components - change this point to <1/x, 1/y>
      -- and returns this DPoint.
      Precondition: the x and y components are not 0.
      double length()
      Return the length of this vector.
      static double length​(DPoint a)
      Return the length of a.
      DPoint mult​(double s)
      Multiply both of this point's components by s and return this DPoint.
      double radAngle​(DPoint b)
      Return the angle between this and b, in radians.
      static double radAngle​(DPoint a, DPoint b)
      Return the angle between a and b, in radians.
      DPoint to​(DPoint b)
      Return a new point from this to b.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Return a string representation of this vector: .
      DPoint unit()
      Make this vector have length 1, with the same direction,
      and Return this DPoint.
      Precondition: this point is not (0, 0).

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • invert

        public DPoint invert()
        Invert both of this' components - change this point to <1/x, 1/y>
        -- and returns this DPoint.
        Precondition: the x and y components are not 0.

      • unit

        public DPoint unit()
        Make this vector have length 1, with the same direction,
        and Return this DPoint.
        Precondition: this point is not (0, 0).

                         DPoint b)

      • cross

        public static double cross​(DPoint a,
                           DPoint b)
        Return the cross product of a and b.
        Because vectors are 2-d, the return is a vector of the form <0, 0, z>
        So a 1-D vector.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Hash this point based on its components, using function Objects.hash.
        Round both components to the nearest TOLERANCE
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object ob)
        Return true iff ob is a DPoint and is equal to this one.
        Two points are equal if their components are equal
        - thus checks if they have the same hashcodes,
        which are built off of their components
